author: Special Correspondent
text:
The police have detained two prime accused in the BJP youth wing leader murder case under National Security Act.

Acting on recommendations of Superintendent of Police N. Manivannan, Collector S. Natarajan passed the orders on Friday to detain V. Devarajan (23) and M. Bala alias ‘Parambai’ Bala (41), under preventive detention.

Paramakudi Taluk Inspector of Police Edward Britto served the orders on the accused on Saturday. The officer served the order on Devarajan, the first accused in the murder case lodged at Madurai Central Prison, and on Bala at the district jail here, police said. After the order was served, he was also lodged in Madurai prison.

The two accused were part of a 12-member gang, which had conspired and hacked to death C. Ramesh (30), Kalayarkoil BJP youth wing deputy secretary, at Thenpoduvakudi near Paramakudi when he was on his way to his father-in-law’s house at Puzhuthikulam on the night of November 23.

The police cracked the case the very next day. All the 12 accused in the case were arrested and remanded.
title: Two detained under NSA
